description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the remote code execution vulnerability in the Microsoft WDAC OLE DB provider for SQL Server (CVE-2024-21368):

1. Ensure your system is updated to the necessary build number.
2. Download and install the relevant KB updates from the Microsoft Update Catalog:
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2, install [KB5034763](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034763).
   - For Windows 10 Version 21H2, install [KB5034766](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034766).
   - For Windows 10 Version 10 and 32-bit systems, install [KB5034774](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034774).
   - Similarly, for Windows 11 Versions, install [KB5034765](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5034765).
3. Restart your system to finalize the installation.

**Details**:
- These updates address the heap-based buffer overflow that could allow remote code execution.
- Ensure all data is backed up before proceeding.
- Applicable for Windows 10 and Windows 11 builds as specified in the metadata.
